I have experience with integration testing but not much with unit testing.
I've been reading up on unit testing  (e.g. mock objects, test first
development).  However, I have not found an article that explains the
advantages of unit testing vs integration testing.  My perhaps naive hunch
is that the cost-per-bug-eliminated of unit testing is higher than that of
integration testing.  It appears this way because a single integration test
tests a lot more code than a single unit test and takes about the same
amount of time to construct.  Plus it seems to me that a whole suite of unit
tests with 100% code coverage cannot guarantee that even the simplest system
wide behavior is correct (e.g. the web page appears).  Am I wrong about
this?  Can someone refer me information about this topic.  A scientific
study paper with real numbers would be welcome.

Mike Bresnahan
